ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the basics of the Chinese language and how to have a basic conversation. Skills include reading, speaking, and overall development of vocabulary and grammar.
I heavily developed my Chinese skills in terms of speaking, reading, vocabulary, and writing on the computer.
I learned skills that were beneficial for studying foreign languages, as well as study habits to better acquire mastery of a foreign language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I liked how engaging the course was, calling on different students to practice speaking so that it trains them to better develop their sense of the language. The major weaknesses would be the large amount of work required in the class. I think some of it should be optional.
The course is very good at teaching the basics of Chinese. The only weakness of it is that it has a high workload, though that is necessary to learn the language well.

The course is very well-paced and the homework assignments and material covered in class are incredibly beneficial to the learning of a foreign language and help supplement the textbook material. The varying types of assessments, such as oral exams and daily quizzes, I believe to be a good way to learn the material and better understand it.
Lots of structured help requires tutorial sessions to improve your speaking skills.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, the course is great for learning the basic of Chinese and the teacher and teaching fellow were both very nice and helpful.

I would definitely recommend this course to other students. The skills developed in this class are essential and applicable to other subjects, but the learning of Chinese itself is also a very fulfilling and enjoyable experience.
Yes if you are interested in Chinese go for it!
